details.description:
Shimla

Shimla, the capital of Himachal Pradesh, is the most visited hill station in India. The city is loved by people for their honeymoon destinations and family vacations. The city is recognized as a World Heritage site by UNESCO, for its unique cultural and geographical identity in 2008.

The city offers a lot of sightseeing like The Ridge, Mall road famous for its handicraft market, Viceregal lodge and Botanical garden, Jakhu Hill famous temple, Gaiety Theatre, Chadwick falls, Sheeshe wali Kothi known for its architect and history Tibetan Refugee market, and much more.

One can enjoy a lot of adventurous sports activities like Ice Skating, Snow points, Jakhu Ropeway, camping, Trekking, River rafting, Toy train, Paragliding, Pine forest walks, cycling etc. are the activities that one enjoys.

Chitkul

A village in the Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh at an elevation of 11000 feet, the place mostly remains under snow cover, Mathi temple , Charanag chitkul pass one of the toughest terrain, Rakchham Chitkul wildlife sanctuary. This village is also called the “last village of India'' . Offers a fascinating view of nature's true face.

Kufri

Kufri is a prominent hill station 20 km away from the capital of Himachal Pradesh Shimla , this destination is situated at an elevation of 9000 feet from sea level. This destination is very popular among the visitors as it offers a lot of adventurous activities as well as a lot of sightseeing like Skiing, Horse riding, Yak riding, Kufri zoo, Green valley, Shimla resort forest etc. These all will make your holiday memorable.

itinerary.title: DELHI TO SHIMLA
brief: We will begin our journey in the evening at 9 P.M by AC Vehicle

itinerary.title: MOVE TO THE LAST TOWNLET- CHITKUL NIGHT HALT AT CHITKUL
brief: In the morning we will depart to Chitkul at about 7 am
It's roughly a 10 to 11 hours long expedition travelling via the mountains
Chitkul is one of the most fascinating places on this beautiful earth
Chitkul has a river flowing right beside it at a very high elevation. This place is alone a full package of natural sights
In the night have a flavorful dinner and Night halt in Chitkul

itinerary.title: LAST VILLAGE (CHITKUL) TO CAPITAL SHIMLA
brief: Have a delicious breakfast, and now it is time to reposition to Shimla
Reach Shimla, Check-in into the Hotel
After a short break, Be prepared to explore nearby places. See the exquisite Himalayas with the wonderful sunset
At night enjoy the beauty of the moment with relaxing Music, and a mouthwatering dinner, Night halt at the hotel in Shimla

itinerary.title: SHIMLA & KUFRI - LOCAL VISIT
brief: After breakfast, Move to Kufri local sightseeing
Kufri is a scenic hill station at 20 km away from Shimla
Later on, Sightseeing, Visit the most popular Church and enjoy some time on Shimla Mall road before leaving for Delhi at night
Repack your bags now it’s time to move to your home destination Delhi by 8 PM

inclusion: Meals will be provided throughout the trip every day (1 breakfast and 1 dinner)
exclusion: Sports and Adventure Activities not included in the itinerary
Any Snacks/ Drinks other than those provided

details.description:
Rishikesh

Rishikesh YOGA capital of the world is a well-known destination for spiritual practice and nature lovers. The Place is famous among youth mostly for river rafting, trekking and Summer camps.

Rishikesh is also called the Devbhoomi ( land of god) for various religious places associated with Hinduism. Rishikesh has the most ancient and famous temples in India, like Neelkhanth Mahadev, Bhootnath Temple, Raghunath Temple, Trayambakeshwar temple, Lakshman temple And many more temples.

The foothill of the Himalayas provides it with a very attractive geographical location, along with the Ganga river, Ram jhula, Laxman jhula, Neer Garh waterfall, all these things made this place a perfect holiday destination for visitors with family and friends.

Mussoorie

Mussoorie the queen of hills is a gorgeous hill station destination at an elevation of 6600 feet from the mean sea level. This destination is situated at the foothill of the Himalayas. This destination was established by Britishers for their holiday destination, now this location is very popular among Indians.

Mossy Fall, Company garden, Nag Devta Temple, Gun Hill, Adventure Park Mussoorie, Kempty fall, Dalai Hills, and St. Paul’s Church, lkya island are the local sights that one can visit.

itinerary.title: DELHI TO RISHIKESH
brief: We will start our journey to Rishikesh at midnight from Delhi

itinerary.title: YOGA CAPITAL ( RISHIKESH)
brief: By the morning reach the wonderful land of Rishikesh, check into your camps, and get yourself refreshed, take a short rest
After having a delicious breakfast, we will head out to get a stunning experience of river rafting
Enjoy your complete day with the joy and thrill, at the evening retreat to your camp
In the night have a tasty feast, bid goodbye to this day, Night halt at the campsite

itinerary.title: RISHIKESH -  QUEEN OF HILLS (MUSSOORIE )
brief: Get up early in the morning to welcome a new day, have a mouthwatering breakfast, and leave your accommodation to move forward
Head towards Queen of hills Mussoorie
Reach Mussoorie and check in at the hotel
Later move out to visit The Mall road, Camels back road, Company garden, etc
Come back to the accommodation
Have an appetizing dinner and Night halt at the hotel

itinerary.title: MUSSOORIE TO HOME
brief: In the early morning get with the chirping of birds around you, Have a tasty breakfast, and leave the hotel
Afterwards, We will move out for other sightseeing in the city
See Lal Tibba's scenic point, Kempty falls and Sahastradhara falls
Now it’s time to backpack to get back to your home
Collect a lot of memories in the drive of your memory collection

inclusion: Meals will be provided throughout the trip every day (1 breakfast and 1 dinner)
exclusion: Sports and Adventure Activities not included in the itinerary
Any Snacks/ Drinks other than those provided

details.description:
Manali

In a lifetime, we all want to have been a Manali once either with friends or with family. Manali is the most liked honeymoon and holiday destination for couples and solo trips. At the end of Kullu valley, near the Beas river, this beautiful city is located.

It is also a pass to Leh-Ladakh through various mountain passes at a height of 13000 feet making it a natural way to Ladakh, these passes include Rohtang La pass, Baralacha La pass, and Nakee La pass.

Lakes, grassland, a forest of deodar, a waterfall, a garden and other picturesque sites make this destination more attractive to visitors.

Adventure and sports like Paragliding, Rafting, Zorbing, Trekking, and Skiing are the prominent activities of this place.

Hadimba temple, Manikarn Gurudwara, Gompa Buddhist temple, and many others are the Religious and spiritual sights at this destination, which makes it more divine for visitors of different religions.

Jispa

Jispa is a small townlet in Himachal Pradesh 120 km away from Manali, at the height of 10000 feet and is well-known for the night halt by travellers on their journey to Leh. The village is situated on the bank of the river Bhaga, surrounded by lofty mountains, the village has a monastery and cottages for camping.

itinerary.title: DELHI TO MANALI
brief: Departure from Delhi in the evening

itinerary.title: LOCAL SIGHTSEEING
brief: Reach the destination in the morning. Check in to the hotel, get yourself refreshed
Have a delicious Breakfast
After some recreation, Now it's time for local sightseeing
In the Evening, Head towards the street of Manali for Cafe Hopping
Dinner and  Night stay at the hotel

itinerary.title: MANALI - ATAL TUNNEL - KEYLONG - BARALACHA LA - JISPA
brief: Wake up early in the morning, have a tasty breakfast and leave the hotel
Afterwards, start your new day with the road trip to Jispa via the Atal tunnel
Visit the Sissu waterfall and then we will go for Baralacha La pass, it is one of the highest passes on the Manali Leh highway at an altitude of approx 16090  feet
This is time for jispa Jispa
Reach Jispa, and check in to the camps
Dinner will be served and overnight stay in Jispa

itinerary.title: JISPA - ROHTANG - MANALI
brief: Wake up at the Campsite
After Breakfast checks out the camps, and then head towards  Manali
It will be a journey of approx. 4 to 5 hours, we will also visit Rohtang Pass while commencing to Manali
Reach Manali by afternoon and later you are free to explore The local market and The Mall road for some last-minute shopping experience
Then board your vehicle
Later in the evening, we departed for Delhi with lots of everlasting memories together

inclusion: Meals will be provided throughout the trip every day (1 breakfast and 1 dinner)
exclusion: Sports and Adventure Activities not included in the itinerary
Any Snacks/ Drinks other than those provided

details.description:
Manali

In a lifetime, we all want to have been a Manali once either with friends or with family. Manali is the most liked honeymoon and holiday destination for couples and solo trips. At the end of Kullu valley, near the Beas river, this beautiful city is located.

It is also a pass to Leh-Ladakh through various mountain passes at a height of 13000 feet making it a natural way to Ladakh, these passes include Rohtang La pass, Baralacha La pass, and Nakee La pass.

Lakes, grassland, a forest of deodar, a waterfall, a garden and other picturesque sites make this destination more attractive to visitors.

Adventure and sports like Paragliding, Rafting, Zorbing, Trekking, and Skiing are the prominent activities of this place.

Hadimba temple, Manikarn Gurudwara, Gompa Buddhist temple, and many others are the Religious and spiritual sights at this destination, which makes it more divine for visitors of different religions.

Jispa

Jispa is a small townlet in Himachal Pradesh 120 km away from Manali, at the height of 10000 feet and is well-known for the night halt by travellers on their journey to Leh. The village is situated on the bank of the river Bhaga, surrounded by lofty mountains, the village has a monastery and cottages for camping.

itinerary.title: DELHI TO MANALI
brief: Departure from Delhi in the evening

itinerary.title: LOCAL SIGHTSEEING
brief: Reach the destination in the morning. Check in to the hotel, get yourself refreshed
Have a delicious Breakfast
After some recreation, Now it's time for local sightseeing
In the Evening, Head towards the street of Manali for Cafe Hopping
Dinner and  Night stay at the hotel

itinerary.title: MANALI - ATAL TUNNEL - KEYLONG - BARALACHA LA - JISPA
brief: Wake up early in the morning, have a tasty breakfast and leave the hotel
Afterwards, start your new day with the road trip to Jispa via the Atal tunnel
Visit the Sissu waterfall and then we will go for Baralacha La pass, it is one of the highest passes on the Manali Leh highway at an altitude of approx 16090  feet
This is time for jispa Jispa
Reach Jispa, and check in to the camps
Dinner will be served and overnight stay in Jispa

itinerary.title: JISPA - ROHTANG - MANALI
brief: Wake up at the Campsite
After Breakfast checks out the camps, and then head towards  Manali
It will be a journey of approx. 4 to 5 hours, we will also visit Rohtang Pass while commencing to Manali
Reach Manali by afternoon and later you are free to explore The local market and The Mall road for some last-minute shopping experience
Then board your vehicle
Later in the evening, we departed for Delhi with lots of everlasting memories together

Spiti Valley

Spiti valley, the valley of the cold desert is located in the state of Himachal Pradesh at an elevation of 13000 feet from the mean sea level, this valley is very popular among youth due to its fascinating views.

The time of summer is the best fit time to visit this destination, the pleasant weather during this period made this destination more delightful for the visitors.

Mussoorie

Mussoorie the queen of hills is a gorgeous hill station destination at an elevation of 6600 feet from the mean sea level. This destination is situated at the foothill of the Himalayas. This destination was established by Britishers for their holiday destination, now this location is very popular among Indians.

Mossy Fall, Company garden, Nag Devta Temple, Gun Hill, Adventure Park Mussoorie, Kempty fall, Dalai Hills, and St. Paul’s Church, lkya island are the local sights that one can visit.

itinerary.title: DELHI TO MANALI
brief: We will begin our journey from Delhi around 6 PM in an AC Vehicle

itinerary.title: FIRST DAY IN MANALI
brief: We will arrive at Manali by early morning.
Check in the hotel and get yourself refreshed. And take a short rest
Afterwards, we will head out for the regional sightseeing of Manali
Attend prayer at Hadimba temple, Vashisht Temple, Thereafter come back to Manali restaurants and The Mall
Back to the accommodation at dusk
Have a mouthwatering Dinner and Night's halt in the hotel

itinerary.title: SPITI VALLEY - KAZA
brief: Get up, wake up in the majestic valley of the world, breathe in the fresh air, enjoy a flavorful breakfast, and go out
Afterward, you will begin your trek through the Spiti Valley

It is time to continue our journey to Rohtang Pass and behold the changing vegetation. After experiencing adventure paradise in Lahaul, it is time to turn towards the Rohtang Pass and observe the changing vegetation
Following that, we will travel through Kunzum La
Until you reach Kaza, you will see many different landscapes
Upon arrival at Kaza at sunset, check in to your rooms and recuperate
For dinner, have a mouth-watering feed, then stay at the hotel

itinerary.title: KEY MONASTERY – PIN VALLEY
brief: The desert of snow awaits you in the morning. Take breakfast early in the morning.
We are now heading to the Key or Ki Monastery
Our next stop will be the Kungri Monastery in Pin valley, followed by a stop at the Dhankar Monastery.
Return to Kaza
We halted for dinner and the night at the hotel under the stars

itinerary.title: KOMIK – LANGZA – HIKKIM
brief: Get some delicious food to start the day in the morning by waking up early
Thereafter, a local sightseeing tour of the Spiti Valley is scheduled.
Visit Komic, the highest village on Earth.
After that, we will stroll through Hikkim. It has the world's highest Post Office
A peaceful sunset at Langza with a picturesque landscape of a massive Buddha statue is a beautiful end to a long day for me.
Back to the accommodation in the evening. Have dinner and stay the night

itinerary.title: KAZA - CHICHAM BRIDGE -CHANDRATAL
brief: Having breakfast at the hotel, we depart on our way to Chandratal Lake
En route to Chandratal Lake, we will see the highest bridge in Asia at Chicham village
stop for lunch in the last village of this wonderful destination
Spend the night in Chandra Taal (subject to weather conditions) and see the Milky Way Galaxy and a million stars as you dine.

itinerary.title: BACK TO  MANALI - DELHI
brief: Awaken to a beautiful sunrise and after breakfast, leave the hotel
Then, depart for Manali, arrive in Manali by afternoon
Visit some cafes
Pack your bags and depart by evening for Delhi
Reach Delhi by the next morning with lots of remarkable memories

details.description:
Kerala, the southwest state of India, along the Arabian sea is a major tourist destination due to its famous hill stations and for its lush green vegetation. The weather of this destination always remains a pleasant best fit for tourists to visit at a point in time. Malabar coast made the sea boundary of the state, on the other side peaks of western ghats, along with beautiful lakes and rivers enhance the beauty of this destination.

. The top places visited by tourists include Varkala beach, Athirappily waterfalls, Sree Padmanabhaswamy temple, Silent Valley National Park, Edakkal caves, Photo Point, Tea museum, Attukad waterfalls, Wonder valley Adventure park.

TreeHouse stays Tea estate tours, camping, Trekking, Spotting rare species of animals, Mountain biking, Rock climbing, shikara rides, boathouses, Elephant safari, and natural spas are the things that one can enjoy at this destination.

itinerary.title: DELHI TO kochi
brief: Our journey will begin. (MYTP)

itinerary.title: KOCHI TO MUNNAR
brief: Arrive at 9:30 am at the Kochi airport.
Once there, we will head to Munnar
Upon your arrival at the airport, our representative will greet you and take you to Munnar. On our way to Munnar, we will visit Cheeyappara & Vallarta Waterfalls
After reaching Munnar, check in to the hotel, and have some recreation activities
Delicious dinner and Overnight halt in Munnar at the hotel

itinerary.title: MUNNAR LOCAL SIGHTSEEING
brief: After eating breakfast, move to the Tea states
lore the rose garden, the photo point, the eco point, the Mattupetty dam, and the Chennai shooting point
Next, we will visit KDHP Tea Tasting, Tata Tea Museum, & Eravikulam National Park, if it is on the museum's schedule
Delicious dinner and Overnight halt in Munnar at the hotel

itinerary.title: MUNNAR TO THEKKADY
brief: After taking a meal in the morning, leave the hotel room to continue our expedition further toward Thekkady
Get in the Hotel at Thekkady, and be prepared to explore the Spice land of India
Thereafter we will visit Periyar national park
At the Kadathanadan Kalari Centre, you can also watch a Kathakali-Kalari show if time permits
Spend the night at the Thekkady Hotel

itinerary.title: THEKKADY TO ALLEPPEY
brief: Start your day with breakfast and then head to Alleppey, the 'backwater capital of Kerala
You will be accommodated on a thrilling houseboat when you arrive at this backwater destination
After this, sail through the hinterland, locate your swaying beauty of the thin canals, lush paddy fields, coconut farms, lagoons, and coir villages
Tasty dinner and overnight stay in Alleppey Houseboat

itinerary.title: ALLEPPEY TO VARKALA
brief: Take breakfast, Afterwards move to Varkala beach, one of the most picturesque beaches in Kerala
Enjoy some recreational activities at the ultimate beach.
Spend a little time at Virgin beach Papanasam and later visit the Sivagiri Memorial of Late, Sri Narayana Guru, and Janardhana Swami Temple
NIght halt and dinner at Varkala hotel.

itinerary.title: VARKALA TO MUNROE ISLAND
brief: Take breakfast, Now it’s time to roll to Munroe via boat
At the end visit the Jatayu earth centre, the sculpture of Jatayu mentioned in Ramayana
Return to the hotel, Later go for some local sightseeing in Varkala
NIght halt and dinner at Varkala hotel

itinerary.title: VARKALA TO TRIVANDRUM
brief: Post breakfast, Now it’s time to leave the hotel and move to Trivandrum Airport
Back home with millions of memories to cherish

inclusion: Meals will be provided throughout the trip every day (1 breakfast and 1 dinner)
exclusion: Sports and Adventure Activities not included in the itinerary
Any Snacks/ Drinks other than those provided

Malabar coast made the sea boundary of the state, on the other side peaks of western ghats, along with beautiful lakes and rivers enhance the beauty of this destination.

. The top places visited by tourists include Varkala beach, Athirappily waterfalls, Sree Padmanabhaswamy temple, Silent Valley National Park, Edakkal caves, Photo Point, Tea museum, Attukad waterfalls, Wonder valley Adventure park.

TreeHouse stays Tea estate tours, camping, Trekking, Spotting rare species of animals, Mountain biking, Rock climbing, shikara rides, boathouses, Elephant safari, and natural spas are the things that one can enjoy at this destination.

itinerary.title: KOCHI TO MUNNAR

After reaching Munnar, check in to the hotel, and have some recreation activities
Delicious dinner and Overnight halt in Munnar at the hotel

brief: After eating breakfast, move to the Tea states
lore the rose garden, the photo point, the eco point, the Mattupetty dam, and the Chennai shooting point

Delicious dinner and Overnight halt in Munnar at the hotel

You will be accommodated on a thrilling houseboat when you arrive at this backwater destination

NIght halt and dinner at Varkala hotel.

details.description:
Char Dham yatra is one of the most important rituals in Hinduism. Dham means the sacred place every person in their lifetime wants to visit at least once at this sacred place. The Chhota char Dham yatra in Uttarakhand comprises many sacred places with religious importance.

Uttarakhand alone has many sacred places like Haridwar, Rishikesh, Uttarkashi, Rudraprayag, Devprayag and many more, But out of these Char Dham yatra of Badrinath, Kedarnath, Gangotri, and Yamunotri is of top-most importance.

Badrinath

Badrinath is a sacred place in the Chamoli district of Uttarakhand at an elevation of 10000 feet, this place is a part of Char Dham of India which compromises Badrinath, Jagrnath puri, Dwarka, and Rameshwaram. This Badrinath temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu, there is a belief that Lord Vishnu meditated for thousand years at this place for the liberation of this earth.

Kedarnath

Kedarnath, the place of Lord Shiva. In India, Kedarnath is one of the most prominent pilgrimage sites since ancient times. It is one of the 12 jyotirlingas of lord shiva, this destination attracts a lot of people every year due to its spiritual importance as well as its attractive establishment in the lap of Nature, surrounded by the snow-covered Himalayas attracting thousands of travellers to this site.

This place is approx. 220 km away from Rishikesh, At an elevation of 11000 feet near the source of the Mandakini river, surrounded by Kedarnath mountain. The lush green vegetation and 22000 feet high Kedarnath peak make it more attractive for trekking and camping.

Haridwar

Haridwar, the holy land, is the city visited by thousands of pilgrims every year. From Haridwar onward The Holy Ganga starts its journey to the plains, many sacred ghats and temples made this city a spiritual capital for tourists, from the whole world. Every few years, this city organises Maha Kumb which attracts lakhs of devotees from all over the country.

Gangotri

Gangotri, this place is located at an elevation of 11000 feet. This place is the origin point of the Holy Bhagirathi or Ganga river. At this place there is a temple of Goddess Ganga, it is a belief that Ganga came down to earth from Swarg at this place.

Yamunotri

Yamunotri hamlet in Uttarkashi, district of Uttarakhand, is the origin of the Holy Yamuna river; this place is situated at an elevation of 10500 feet. This place is 227 km away from the Gangotri, the place of origin of the Holy Ganga. The shrine at this destination is dedicated to the goddess the Yamuna.

itinerary.title: DELHI TO CHOTA CHAR DHAM
brief: We will begin our journey in the evening

itinerary.title: Arrival Delhi – Haridwar
brief: Our journey to Chota char Dham will start from Delhi and our first stoppage will be in Haridwar, For the onward journey, we will have to get our biometrics done
After reaching Haridwar, get your key to the room and get refreshed yourself. In the evening visit local sightseeing in Haridwar and prepare yourself for a further Journey
Looks like you are tired now, so now it’s time to have a delicious dinner and Night halt at a hotel in Haridwar

itinerary.title: Drive from Haridwar to Barkot
brief: Wake up in the morning to continue our expedition further, Now we will move to Barkot/ Jankichatti. In Uttarkashi district, Barkot is a hill station on the bank of the Yamuna river. On our way to Barkot, we will visit Kempty Falls in Mussoorie
Upon arrival at the Barkot go to your hotel or camps. Now onward the whole day you can relax and prepare yourself for the next day’s journey for Yamunotri
Looks like you have rested a lot, Now it’s time for dinner

itinerary.title: Barkot– Yamunotri – Barkot
brief: Today we will visit Yamunotri Dham. After that, we will have to visit Hanuman Chatti and Janki Chatti. Now from here, we will start our fast mountain talk to Yamunotri. You can also hire mules and palikis here if you are unable to walk
Now we will travel through the splendid green valleys of the Himalayas
On reaching Yamunotri take a deep into Holy Yamunotri and worship here
Now we have to go back from the journey now so that we can start our tomorrow's journey well
Now it seems that you are very tired after today's journey. Now you should take a rest after dinner

itinerary.title: Drive Barkot – Uttarkashi
brief: Now drop the Barkot, after breakfast, we will leave for Uttarkashi, Uttarkashi is situated on the bank of the Bhagirathi river where there are many historical sites and temples, and ashrams
At night have a delicious dinner and a night halt at Uttarkashi

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi – Gangotri – Uttarkashi
brief: After breakfast in the morning, we will leave the hotel for Gangotri Dham. Here we will see a lofty Himalayan mountain
Here we will take bath in a Bhagirathi river after that we will worship Maa Ganga
That was enough for today now we will go back to our Accommodation and have a dinner and night's stay in the hotel

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi – Guptkashi
brief: Now our next stop is GuptKashi. After having a delicious breakfast we will leave early in the morning for guptkashi
After reaching guptkashi go to your respective rooms, the ancient Kedarnath is at a distance of about 50 km from here
Now we have to get a medical checkup done for our next day's trip to Kedarnath in the night, have a delicious dinner and a night halt at the hotel

itinerary.title: Guptkashi – Sonprayag – Kedarnath
brief: Early morning after having breakfast in the lap of Himalaya we will leave our rooms and start our journey from sonprayag to Kedarnath
You can book mules and horses from here at your own cost
Enjoy the beautiful view in the beautiful hills of the Kedarnath while chanting Jai Bholenath. After reaching Kedarnath you can rest in the government tent

itinerary.title: Kedarnath – Sonprayag – Guptkashi/Rudraprayag
brief: Get up before sunrise at 4:30 in the morning, and get ready for the darshan of Bholenath. What your wishes are asked for from the Bholenath he will definitely bless you with that thing
No, we will start our tour from Kedarnath to Sonprayag and will stay the night in the hotel

itinerary.title: Rudraprayag / Guptkashi – Joshimath – Badrinath
brief: In the morning have breakfast, after that, we will move forward to Badrinath via Joshimath this is an important Hindu pilgrimage site in the Uttrakhand

We will reach Badrinath through the remote  Himalayan valleys, Up reaching hair go to your respective room and get yourself refreshed. In the evening we will go to Badrinath Temple for Darshan before then taking a bath in the tapt kund hot spring
Today was a very tiring day, now we will go for dinner and after that a night halt

itinerary.title: Badrinath – Joshimath – Rudraprayag
brief: In the morning we will visit Badrinath Temple Darshan after that we will see many other local sights. After that, we will visit Vyas Gufa, Ganesh Gufa, Mata Murti Temple
In the afternoon leave out your room, now we will go toward Karan Prayag Rudraprayag why is Joshimath which is a very important religious pilgrimage place for Hindus

itinerary.title: Rudraprayag – Rishikesh
brief: Now we will wake up in the morning to have breakfast and continue our journey downward. We will come to Rishikesh which is a very famous place for pilgrimage. At this place, we will see the confluence of the river Ganga and Chandra Bhaga which is a very beautiful sight
You can go to your room from there you are completely free to go to Ram Jhula Laxman Jhula and whatever places you want
Ganga aarti in the evening is meant to purify your body and mind
Later, come back to your room and enjoy your meal

itinerary.title: Departure Delhi
brief: This is the last day of your 12th day Chota char Dham yatra. After breakfast in the morning, you can leave for your home destination Delhi with lots of memories

brief: Today we will visit Yamunotri Dham. After that, we will have to visit Hanuman Chatti and Janki Chatti. Now from here, we will start our fast mountain talk to Yamunotri. You can also hire mules and palikis here if you are unable to walk
Now we will travel through the splendid green valleys of the Himalayas
On reaching Yamunotri take a deep into Holy Yamunotri and worship here
Now we have to go back from the journey now so that we can start our tomorrow's journey well
Now it seems that you are very tired after today's journey. Now you should take a rest after dinner

itinerary.title: Drive Barkot – Uttarkashi
brief: Now drop the Barkot, after breakfast, we will leave for Uttarkashi, Uttarkashi is situated on the bank of the Bhagirathi river where there are many historical sites and temples, and ashrams
At night have a delicious dinner and a night halt at Uttarkashi

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi – Gangotri – Uttarkashi
brief: After breakfast in the morning, we will leave the hotel for Gangotri Dham. Here we will see a lofty Himalayan mountain
Here we will take bath in a Bhagirathi river after that we will worship Maa Ganga
That was enough for today now we will go back to our Accommodation and have a dinner and night's stay in the hotel

itinerary.title: Uttarkashi – Guptkashi
brief: Now our next stop is GuptKashi. After having a delicious breakfast we will leave early in the morning for guptkashi
After reaching guptkashi go to your respective rooms, the ancient Kedarnath is at a distance of about 50 km from here
Now we have to get a medical checkup done for our next day's trip to Kedarnath in the night, have a delicious dinner and a night halt at the hotel

itinerary.title: Guptkashi – Sonprayag – Kedarnath
brief: Early morning after having breakfast in the lap of Himalaya we will leave our rooms and start our journey from sonprayag to Kedarnath
You can book mules and horses from here at your own cost
Enjoy the beautiful view in the beautiful hills of the Kedarnath while chanting Jai Bholenath. After reaching Kedarnath you can rest in the government tent

itinerary.title: Kedarnath – Sonprayag – Guptkashi/Rudraprayag
brief: Get up before sunrise at 4:30 in the morning, and get ready for the darshan of Bholenath. What your wishes are asked for from the Bholenath he will definitely bless you with that thing
No, we will start our tour from Kedarnath to Sonprayag and will stay the night in the hotel

itinerary.title: Rudraprayag / Guptkashi – Joshimath – Badrinath
brief: In the morning have breakfast, after that, we will move forward to Badrinath via Joshimath this is an important Hindu pilgrimage site in the Uttrakhand

We will reach Badrinath through the remote  Himalayan valleys, Up reaching hair go to your respective room and get yourself refreshed. In the evening we will go to Badrinath Temple for Darshan before then taking a bath in the tapt kund hot spring
Today was a very tiring day, now we will go for dinner and after that a night halt

itinerary.title: Badrinath – Joshimath – Rudraprayag
brief: In the morning we will visit Badrinath Temple Darshan after that we will see many other local sights. After that, we will visit Vyas Gufa, Ganesh Gufa, Mata Murti Temple
In the afternoon leave out your room, now we will go toward Karan Prayag Rudraprayag why is Joshimath which is a very important religious pilgrimage place for Hindus

itinerary.title: Rudraprayag – Rishikesh
brief: Now we will wake up in the morning to have breakfast and continue our journey downward. We will come to Rishikesh which is a very famous place for pilgrimage. At this place, we will see the confluence of the river Ganga and Chandra Bhaga which is a very beautiful sight
You can go to your room from there you are completely free to go to Ram Jhula Laxman Jhula and whatever places you want
Ganga aarti in the evening is meant to purify your body and mind
Later, come back to your room and enjoy your meal

itinerary.title: Departure Delhi
brief: This is the last day of your 12th day Chota char Dham yatra. After breakfast in the morning, you can leave for your home destination Delhi with lots of memories

inclusion: Meals will be provided throughout the trip every day (1 breakfast and 1 dinner)
exclusion: Sports and Adventure Activities not included in the itinerary
Any Snacks/ Drinks other than those provided

details.description:
Dharamshala

Dharamshala is a wonderful hill station in the state of Himachal Pradesh at an elevation of 4700, this destination is surrounded by lower Himalayan ranges, Dalai lama temple, Namgyal monastery, St. John in the wilderness and Kalachakra temple are the major tourist attraction at this destination.

Apart from this Bhagsunag waterfall, Tushita meditation center, Martyrs Park dedicated to the Indian army, and Laka glacier are other tourist attractions.

One can enjoy paragliding, trekking to triund, Camping, Visit to Kangra valley and Kangra fort, along with this one can also do shopping in the local market which is prominent for selling Tibetan handicrafts products.

Mcleodganj

Mcleodganj is a hill station in Kangra district of Himachal Pradesh at an elevation of 6500 feet. This destination is popular for its green lush vegetation and hills. This place is the most famous as the home of the Buddhist spiritual leader the Dalai lama. Bhagsu Falls, Namgyal Monastery, Bhagsunag Temple, Naddi Viewpoint, Dal lake, Chamunda Devi temple, Manimahesh Lake.

itinerary.title: Delhi - Dharamshala
brief: We will begin our journey at & o'clock in the evening, in an AC Volvo/ Traveller/ Car
Enjoy an overnight journey to Dharamshala

itinerary.title: Arrival at Dharamshala & local sightseeing
brief: Upon your arrival in Dharamshala, our representative will welcome you, and will drive you to your accommodation

Check into your Hotel, Get yourself refreshed and be prepared for Local sights visits of Dharamshala. After the annexation of Tibet by China, many Tibet refugees took shelter here, this is the reason this place is called the Buddhist capital of India
Trek to Dharamshala Cricket Stadium, Tibetan market, Enchanting Sunset from the hilltop
Have a mouthwatering dinner and Night halt in the wonderful valley

itinerary.title: Mcleodganj sightseeing
brief: Waken up in the lap of nature, Get yourself freshen up Have a tasty breakfast and be prepared to Head toward Mcleodganj regional sights
Tibetan Handicraft market, Bhagsunath Waterfall, Charming just. John Norbuligka Church
A mouthwatering dinner and after that night halt in mcleodganj

itinerary.title: Departure from Mcleodganj
brief: On the final and most important day of this tour, After taking breakfast, leave your hotel.
Move to Dharamshala the main Dalia lama temple, Tsuglagkhang the Main Temple of Buddhism, the Temple Houses Which are Sakyamuni Buddha, Avalokitesvara and Padmasambhava
After that, you will be Dropped at the Bus stand, So that You Can move on Further to your return Journey to your home destination
Here our journey ends with lots of remarkable memories

inclusion: Meals will be provided throughout the trip every day (1 breakfast and 1 dinner)
exclusion: Sports and Adventure Activities not included in the itinerary
Any Snacks/ Drinks other than those provided
